title: Review Steering Document: product.md
description:
Requesting approval for **product.md** steering document (P-3 prerequisite, 1 of 3):

**Document Overview:**
- **Length**: ~350 lines
- **Purpose**: Product vision and principles for Assignment 7

**Key Content:**

1. **Product Purpose**
   - Transform SimpleMiner from terrain exploration sandbox into playable Minecraft-like voxel game with AI agent integration

2. **5 Product Principles**
   - **Minecraft Implementation Fidelity**: Every system must follow Minecraft patterns, not generic voxel game patterns
   - **JSON-First Data Architecture**: All game data (blocks, items, recipes) must use JSON format
   - **KISS Over YAGNI for MVP**: Prioritize simple, working implementations over future-proofing (tight deadline 12/12)
   - **KADI Integration as First-Class Feature**: AI agent control is not an add-on but a core gameplay pillar
   - **Widget Pragmatism**: Use existing WidgetSubsystem, refine only blocking features (defer comprehensive redesign)

3. **Feature Scope**
   - 7 major systems: Registry, Inventory, Mining/Placement, UI, AI Agents, Menu, Sound Effects
   - 11 MVP validation items
   - Clear non-goals (mobs, combat, health/hunger, particles, multiplayer, goal-based AI)

4. **Success Metrics**
   - Player can mine → craft → build cycle (Minecraft mechanics)
   - Claude Desktop can spawn and control 3-10 AI agents via KADI WebSocket
   - UI matches Minecraft visual style
   - 60 FPS with inventory open and 3-10 agents

**Alignment with Requirements:**
- Reflects user feedback: JSON-first, Minecraft fidelity, sound effects (FR-7)
- Establishes product direction for A7 and future assignments
- Provides clear success criteria and non-goals

**Next Steps After Approval:**
- Review tech.md (technical architecture)
- Review structure.md (code organization)
- After all three approved, P-3 complete → proceed to design.md
